CreateCallRequest.description: The request payload for create call.

sourceAlternateIdentity.description: The alternate identity of the source of the call if dialing out to a pstn number

requestedCallEvents.description: The requested call events to subscribe to.

CreateCallResponse.description: The response payload of the create call operation.

callLegId.description: Call leg id of the call.

PlayAudioRequest.description: The request payload for playing audio.

audioFileUri.description:
The media resource uri of the play audio request. 
Currently only Wave file (.wav) format audio prompts are supported.
More specifically, the audio content in the wave file must be mono (single-channel),
16-bit samples with a 16,000 (16KHz) sampling rate.

loop.description: The flag indicating whether audio file needs to be played in loop or not.

operationContext.description: The value to identify context of the operation.

audioFileId.description: An id for the media in the AudioFileUri, using which we cache the media resource.

OperationStatus.description: Gets or sets the status of the operation

PlayAudioResponse.description: The response payload for play audio operation.

operationContext.description: Gets or sets the operation context

resultInfo.description: Gets or sets the result info

ResultInfo.description: Result info class to be used to report result status for actions/operations.

code.description:
Gets or sets the result code
For synchronous failures, this maps one-to-one with HTTP responses. For asynchronous failures or messages, it is contextual.

subcode.description:
Gets or sets the result subcode.
The subcode further classifies a failure. For example.

message.description:
Gets or sets the message
The message is a detail explanation of subcode.
